level.text: The facility shall cooperate with the contracting entity and, where applicable, the CSSD to meet the residents’ preventative, routine and emergency health needs, including:
An initial medical screen of each resident by a licensed physician within twenty-four (24) hours of admission into a facility;
Routine medical and dental examinations at intervals recommended by the American Academy of Pediatrics, as specified in ยง 6262.1(b);
Maintenance of required immunizations and booster shots recommended by the American Academy of Pediatrics;
Vision and hearing examinations and provisions for obtaining eye glasses and hearing aids as medically recommended;
Provision of prosthetic and corrective devices prescribed by a physician;
Provision of health and sex education as appropriate to the resident’s age and level of development;
Explanation of all medical and/or psychiatric treatments in language as appropriate to the resident’s age and level of development;
Maintenance, storage and supervision of health records; and
Maintenance, storage, supervision and administration of prescription medications.
Prohibit the use and possession of alcohol and tobacco products by residents or staff, while on the premises of the facility;
Cooperate with the contracting entity and, where applicable, the CSSD to involve the resident’s parent(s) or guardian(s) in the resident’s health and medical care;

Cooperate with the contracting entity and, where applicable, the CSSD to obtain a general written consent upon admission from the resident’s parent(s) or legal guardian(s), or by court order, for the provision of preventative and routine health care; and

Cooperate with the contracting entity and, where applicable, the CSSD to obtain a separate written consent prior to treatment from the resident’s parent(s) or guardian(s), or by court order, for each incidence of non-routine health care.
